title: SP ENW - External Data - Local Authority Polygons
description:
*Dataset content available to registered users only*

SP ENW - Local Authority Polygon Data

Interlocking polygons depicting Local Authority boundaries within the SP Electricity North West control area.

Polygons depicted along the Electricity North West boundary may not represent the entire Local Authority - As only the segment within Electricity North West's control area will be represented.

title: SP ENW - External Data - County Polygons
description:
*Dataset content available to registered users only*

SP ENW - County Polygon Data

Interlocking polygons depicting County boundaries within the SP Electricity North West control area.

Polygons depicted along the SP Electricity North West boundary may not represent the entire County - As only the segment within SP Electricity North West's control area will be represented.

Note

The County defined as 'Other' - Includes areas from Cheshire, North Yorkshire, Derbyshire, Northumberland, Merseyside, Staffordshire.

The County defined as 'Cumberland' - Originated from the split of Cumbria.

While we use reasonable endeavours to ensure that the data contained within this dataset is accurate, we do not accept any responsibility or liability for the accuracy or the completeness of the content held, or for any loss which may arise from reliance on this dataset and/or its related information.

title: SP ENW - Capacity - PRY Heatmap
description:
*Dataset content available to registered users only*

SP ENW - Capacity - Primary Heatmap

Dataset depicting all Primary Substations represented as interlocking Voronoi polygons, The information contained in the dataset will enable developers to assess the level of capacity that might be available for new connections to our network. This capacity dataset contains all the available capacity information on the Primary Substations connected to our network.

The information held in this dataset, along with the three further datasets listed below

Grid Supply Point Connection Queue
Grid Supply Point Capacity
Bulk Supply Point Capacity

Have been combined in a map page  HERE

title: SP ENW - DFES - Bulk Supply Point Polygons
description:
*Dataset content available to registered users only*

SP ENW - DFES - BSP Polygons

Specifically formatted to align with SP ENW DFES data, this Polygon dataset is still created using Voronoi methodology (described below), but includes the polygonal representation of the sites joined together or split through busbars as defined in SP ENW's DFES submission.

Individual Polygons are created using the Voronoi methodology, each one containing a single distribution substation, these individual polygons are first grouped together (based on common attribution) then merged, to create a new series of interlocking polygons forming a high-level representation of Primary Substation feeding areas.

The larger polygons representing the feeding areas of Bulk Supply Points (BSP's) are generated by grouping, then merging, the Primary polygons in the same manner (a similar process creates GSP polygons from the BSP Voronoi).

Document explaining the Voronoi process and creation of the feeding area polygons is available to download from the 'Alternative Exports' section of the Export tab (above)

While we use reasonable endeavours to ensure that the data contained within this dataset is accurate, we do not accept any responsibility or liability for the accuracy or the completeness of the content held, or for any loss which may arise from reliance on this dataset and/or its related information.

If you have any query related to this SP ENW - DFES - BSP Polygons dataset, please contact us  HERE

description:

SP ENW - Embedded Capacity Register – Part 1 – Under 1MW

Part 1 of the ECR provides information to electricity network stakeholders on generation and storage resources (rated between 50kW & <1MW) that are connected, or accepted to connect, to SP Electricity North West’s distribution network. All information is updated on a monthly basis.

description:

SP ENW - Embedded Capacity Register - Supplementary Data

The information made available here for download, completes the available documentation for the Embedded Capacity Register. If you wish to download the entire ECR in its original multi-tab spreadsheet format, it can be located in the 'Alternative Export' section of the Export tab.

This selection of .PDF files accompanies the 3 other Embedded Capacity Register documents (ECR Datasets Parts 1,2 & 3), which collectively generate the content of the Embedded Capacity Register Map.

The 3 x PDF files within this supplementary dataset comprise of:

1 - ECR Contents

SP ENW - Boundary Flow - Merge

The first of three datasets used to create the Boundary Flow portal page, this dataset has merged the following tables to create this composite view

SP ENW - Boundary Flow - GSP

Table listing the average apparent power for each circuit for each half-hourly period (expressed in Megawatts).
Apparent power measures are directional and a positive direction indicates flow from NGET to ENWL.

SP ENW - Boundary Flow - DG BSP

Table listing the mean apparent power exported by generators connected to the SP Electricity North West network on a half-hourly basis (expressed in kVA).
The data is provided aggregated by Bulk Supply Points (BSPs).

SP ENW - Boundary Flow - DG Fuel Types

Table listing the mean apparent power exported by generators connected to the SP Electricity North West network on a half-hourly basis (expressed in kVA).
The data is provided aggregated by Fuel Type at a network-wide level.

The following SP ENW Boundary Flow datasets can also be located in the Data section of this Portal:

SP ENW - Boundary Flow - GSP XY

SP ENW - Boundary Flow - BSP XY

Alternatively, all datasets can be viewed together in the aforementioned portal page HERE

While we use reasonable endeavours to ensure that the data contained within this dataset is accurate, we do not accept any responsibility or liability for the accuracy or the completeness of the content held, or for any loss which may arise from reliance on this dataset and/or its related information.

title: SP ENWL - External Data - LSOA Polygons
description:
*Dataset content available to registered users only*

SP ENW - External Data -  Lower Level Super Output Areas (LSOA) Data

The Office of National Statistics (ONS) make available the Lower layer Super Output Areas (LSOA) dataset. The individual areas are described as comprising between 400 and 1,200 households and have a usually resident population between 1,000 and 3,000 persons.

This dataset contains the LSOA Polygons (sourced from ONS) which have been cropped to only reflect the polygons - or sections thereof, which fall within the Electricity North West Control Boundary

Additional Columns have been added, detailing the KM2 area of each LSOA polygon, alongside the area of the same polygon which falls within the SP ENW boundary (also shown as a percentage value)

title: SP ENW - External Data - DVLA EV Registrations per LSOA
description:
*Dataset content available to registered users only*

SP ENW - External Data - DVLA EV Registrations per LSOA

Dataset mapping the DVLA EV Registration data (VEH0145) to the referenced LSOA Polygon.

The source VEH0145 DVLA dataset, contains a number of entries with a value of 'C' (Classified), This where the number of registrations in any one Calendar quarter < 5. In order to produce a complete dataset, ENWL has approximated these classified registrations to a value of 3.

This dataset references all EV registrations in LSOA polygons falling within ENWL's control boundary, in any one calendar year 2012 - 2023 (2024 QTRs 1 & 2).

Any LSOA polygons containing 100+ EV registration in a calendar year is subject to an OFGEM calculated revision, surmising these high values represent dealership registration - This dataset contains both the summarised annual DVLA registration data (eg column CY_2023) and also the OFGEM revised annual data (eg column  'CY_2023_Revised')

While we use reasonable endeavours to ensure that the data contained within this dataset is accurate, we do not accept any responsibility or liability for the accuracy or the completeness of the content held, or for any loss which may arise from reliance on this dataset and/or its related information.

title: SP ENW - DFES - LV Headroom (Monitored)
description:
*Dataset content available to registered users only*

SP ENW - DFES - LV Headroom (Monitored) Data - New 2024 Dataset

SP ENW is currently using PreSense units to monitor the power of secondary substations, particularly those with a large number of customers. The data is processed in real-time and aggregated into half-hourly intervals. In its RIIO-ED2 Business Plan, SP ENW outlined its plans to achieve 95% network visibility coverage during the price control period using distribution monitoring equipment (PreSense), with the remaining 5% covered by smart meters. As of March 2025, 60% of customers are covered by PreSense. The substations being monitored have been identified because they have been monitored for over a year, providing sufficient data points throughout the period, especially during winter. This real-time monitoring data is used to identify the maximum demand of secondary substations. There is an ongoing programme to identify new sites for monitoring to expand coverage and improve network visibility.

This dataset contains the headroom (kVA) forecast for PreSense-monitored secondary substations, based on the maximum demand forecast and substation transformer ratings.

The collection of DFES datasets envisages a range of possible views of the future, which indicate how different influences can change electrical demand and generation on our network.

This dataset is an accompaniment to our 2024 DFES report, it contains detailed datasets and interactive tools which allow our customers to understand what our Distribution Future Electricity Scenarios mean to them.

Please refer to our main DFES report for a full description of our forecasts and scenarios. Our forecasts are not precise predictions of what the future is likely to be, but instead frame the uncertainty within our planning as explained in the main report.

While we use reasonable endeavours to ensure that the data contained within this dataset is accurate, we do not accept any responsibility or liability for the accuracy or the completeness of the content held, or for any loss which may arise from reliance on this dataset and/or its related information.

title: SP ENW - DFES - LV Peak Demand (Unmonitored)
description:
*Dataset content available to registered users only*

SP ENW - DFES - LV Peak Demand (Unmonitored) Data - New 2024 Dataset

SP ENW is currently using PreSense units to monitor the power of secondary substations, particularly those with a large number of customers. The data is processed in real-time and aggregated into half-hourly intervals. In its RIIO-ED2 Business Plan, SP ENW outlined its plans to achieve 95% network visibility coverage during the price control period using distribution monitoring equipment (PreSense), with the remaining 5% covered by smart meters. As of March 2025, 60% of customers are covered by PreSense. The substations being monitored have been identified because they have been monitored for over a year, providing sufficient data points throughout the period, especially during winter. This real-time monitoring data is used to identify the maximum demand of secondary substations. There is an ongoing programme to identify new sites for monitoring to expand coverage and improve network visibility.

This table contains the maximum demand (kVA) forecast for un-monitored secondary substations up to 2051. The forecast is based on historical peak demand data allocated from the head of High Voltage level feeders using customer count ratios and considers the demand increase from electric vehicles and heat pumps.

The collection of DFES datasets envisages a range of possible views of the future, which indicate how different influences can change electrical demand and generation on our network.

This dataset is an accompaniment to our 2024 DFES report, it contains detailed datasets and interactive tools which allow our customers to understand what our Distribution Future Electricity Scenarios mean to them.

title: SP ENW - DFES - Primary Polygons
description:
*Dataset content available to registered users only*

SP ENW - DFES - Primary Polygons

Specifically formatted to align with SP ENW DFES data, this Polygon dataset is still created using Voronoi methodology (described below), but includes the polygonal representation of the sites joined together or split through busbars as defined in SP ENW's DFES submission.

Individual Polygons are created using the Voronoi methodology, each one containing a single distribution substation, these individual polygons are first grouped together (based on common attribution) then merged, to create a new series of interlocking polygons forming a high-level representation of Primary Substation feeding areas.

The larger polygons representing the feeding areas of Bulk Supply Points (BSP's) are generated by grouping, then merging, the Primary polygons in the same manner (a similar process creates GSP polygons from the BSP Voronoi).

Document explaining the Voronoi process and creation of the feeding area polygons is available to download from the 'Alternative Exports' section of the Export tab (above)

While we use reasonable endeavours to ensure that the data contained within this dataset is accurate, we do not accept any responsibility or liability for the accuracy or the completeness of the content held, or for any loss which may arise from reliance on this dataset and/or its related information.

title: SP ENW - LCT - MCS Data
description:
*Dataset content available to registered users only*

SP ENW - LCT - MCS Data

Dataset exploring the individual Low Carbon Technology installations detailed in the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MCS) Installation Database (MID).

MCS's database carries information across the following LCT installations - Heat Pumps, Small Scale Generation and Battery Storage. This dataset groups these installations together, summarising the values to the relevant SP ENW Distribution Substation.

Only those ENWL Substations feeding 5 or more customers are included in this dataset

title: SP ENW - Capacity - Distribution TX
description:
*Dataset content available to registered users only*

SP ENW - Capacity - Distribution TX Headroom

Dataset depicting the capacity of the Transformer at each Distribution Substation on the High Voltage (11kV and 6.6kV) network, based on the comparison of the estimated maximum demand on each substation with the transformer capacity at that location.

The information contained in this dataset is provided for the primary purpose of allowing existing and potential customers to assess the capabilities of the electricity network and opportunities for changes in their use of the network or for connecting to it. While all reasonable effort has been made to ensure the accuracy of the information, SP Electricity North West will accept no liability for any loss or damage caused by the information not being accurate or the information not being available. Actual changes in supply capacity for existing customers or new connections are subject to detailed assessment and approval by SP Electricity North West, and payment of appropriate charges.

The information contained in this statement is the Copyright of SP Electricity North West. All Rights Reserved.

This data, along with the 11kV and 6.6kV network can be viewed together in a portal page  HERE

title: SP ENW - Substation - Primary Polygons
description:
*Dataset content available to registered users only*

SP ENW - Substation - Primary Polygons

Individual Polygons are created using the Voronoi methodology, each one containing a single distribution substation, these individual polygons are first grouped together (based on common attribution) then merged, to create a new series of interlocking polygons forming a high-level representation of Primary Substation feeding areas.

The larger polygons representing the feeding areas of Bulk Supply Points (BSP's) are generated by grouping, then merging, the Primary polygons in the same manner (a similar process creates GSP polygons from the BSP Voronoi).

Document explaining the Voronoi process and creation of the feeding area polygons is available to download from the 'Alternative Exports' section of the Export tab (above)

While we use reasonable endeavours to ensure that the data contained within this dataset is accurate, we do not accept any responsibility or liability for the accuracy or the completeness of the content held, or for any loss which may arise from reliance on this dataset and/or its related information.

If you have any query related to this SP ENW Substation - Primary Polygons dataset, please contact us  HERE

title: SP ENW - DFES - Entire Network Data
description:
*Dataset content available to registered users only*

SP ENW - DFES – Entire Network Data - New 2024 Dataset

The Entire Network Data section within our Distributed Future Electricity Scenarios (DFES) content, details our view of the North West’s future electricity requirements and represents forecasts based on the entire network within our operational boundary.

The collection of DFES datasets envisages a range of possible views of the future, which indicate how different influences can change electrical demand and generation on our network.

This dataset is an accompaniment to our 2024 DFES report. It contains detailed datasets and interactive tools which allow our customers to understand what our Distribution Future Electricity Scenarios mean to them.

Please refer to our main DFES report for a full description of our forecasts and scenarios. Our forecasts are not precise predictions of what the future is likely to be, but instead frame the uncertainty within our planning as explained in the main report.

While we use reasonable endeavours to ensure that the data contained within this dataset is accurate, we do not accept any responsibility or liability for the accuracy or the completeness of the content held, or for any loss which may arise from reliance on this dataset and/or its related information.

If you have any query related to this DFES Entire Network dataset, please contact us  HERE

title: SP ENW - LSOA - Domestic Heating Demand
description:
*Dataset content available to registered users only*

SP ENW - LSOA - Domestic Heating Demand

Aggregation of Domestic Heating Demand data into pre-defined Lower Super Output Areas (LSOA). Data curated for ENWL by external partner ERM

This aggregated heating demand data for each LSOA is further sub-categorised into one of 20 building archetypes, each a unique combination of 5 separate attributes:-

Fuel - (F) Electric, Gas or Other
Location - (L) Rural or Urban
Size - (S) Large or Small
Tenure - (T) Other or Social
Age - (A) Very Old, Old, Recent or New Build

The combination of values have been concatenated into each of the 20 building archetypes, for example

F-ELECTRIC | L-URBAN | S-LARGE | T-OTHER | A-RECENT | (kWh)

with unit values for all archetypes recorded in kWh.
(Any value shown as 'DNA' indicates data was not available for the Dataset compiler)

While we use reasonable endeavours to ensure that the data contained within this dataset is accurate, we do not accept any responsibility or liability for the accuracy or the completeness of the content held, or for any loss which may arise from reliance on this dataset and/or its related information.

If you have any query related to this LSOA - Domestic Heating Demand dataset, please contact us  HERE

title: SP ENW - Substation - DSO BSP Polygons
description:
*Dataset content available to registered users only*

SP ENW - Substation - DSO BSP Polygons

Individual Polygons are created using the Voronoi methodology, each one containing a single distribution substation, these individual polygons are first grouped together (based on common attribution) then merged, to create a new series of interlocking polygons forming a high-level representation of Primary Substation feeding areas.

The larger polygons representing the feeding areas of Bulk Supply Points (BSP's) are generated by grouping, then merging, the Primary polygons in the same manner (a similar process creates GSP polygons from the BSP Voronoi).

Document explaining the Voronoi process and creation of the feeding area polygons is available to download from the 'Alternative Exports' section of the Export tab (above)

While we use reasonable endeavours to ensure that the data contained within this dataset is accurate, we do not accept any responsibility or liability for the accuracy or the completeness of the content held, or for any loss which may arise from reliance on this dataset and/or its related information.

description:

Biodiversity - Enhancement Opportunity Wetland

This dataset describes the potential opportunity to create new areas of wetland within the defined Biodiversity Site Boundaries.

In this dataset, the Habitat Unit Value is a derived score, calculated from a number of attributes including area availability when infrastructure exclusion zones are deducted, suitability for enhancement based on existing habitat biodiversity value, and the connectiveness potential to other nearby similar habitats

description:
*Dataset content available to registered users only*

This dataset describes the areas within the defined Biodiversity Site Boundaries, which are not deemed provisionally suitable for any new area of Wetland creation without further operational authorisation.

description:

title: LTDS CIM Examples
description:
Our Common Information Model (CIM) combines the historical network data sharing through the Long Term Development Statement (LTDS) with NPg's network models. The CIM models allow any external stakeholder to download our network models and import them into their power systems analysis software, regardless if it is the same software as used by NPg.

The CIM process facilitates the exchange of a comprehensive set of network model data, including equipment, connectivity, operational, geographical, and situational data, in extensible markup language (XML) and resource description framework (RDF) formats.

Please note, these files have been uploaded as early examples as to the direction of the LTDS data sharing process. Any data issues will be corrected in the full release in November 2025.

title: Distribution Substation Service Areas
description:
Our Distribution Substation Service Areas dataset contains the approximate areas served by Northern Powergrids distribution substations. Independent Distribution Network Operator (IDNO) regions have also been added from our IDNO dataset. 

These areas are approximations and should not be used in place of a genuine connections study for identifying what part of our network a property/service is connected to

If you are unsure of any of the column meanings, please hover over the column heading for a description. A methodology for this dataset can be downloaded from the attachment section below.

title: LTDS Appendix 3 - Circuit Data
description:
Our LTDS Appendix 3 dataset contains EHV circuit data from across Northern Powergrid's network. The naming convention for the circuit nodes is made up of the substation name, transformer number or busbar name. In some instances, abbreviations may be used on circuits where the node represents a circuit tee or set of isolators etc. All R, X and B impedance data detailed in this table are given as a percentage on 100 MVA base. The rating of each section is defined as either the continuous rating for cables or spring/autumn rating for overhead lines.

If you are unsure of any of the column meanings, please hover over the column heading for a description.

title: Technical Library
description:
This dataset contains a list of NPg Code of Practice (CoP) and Technical Specification documents. For ease of use, we suggest using the "Index" tab as these have custom column widths to allow all the text to be visible.


This dataset has been temporarily removed due to documents falling out of date. To find the most recent documents, check out our main website here: https://www.northernpowergrid.com/document-library .

title: LTDS Appendix 4 - Transformer Data
description:
Our LTDS Appendix 4 dataset details data relating to the transformers found at Northern Powergrid's primary substations and supply points. The data includes naming conventions, primary and secondary nameplate voltages, R/X/B impedance values, and tap changer information e.g. connections and tapping ranges.

If you are unsure of any of the column meanings, please hover over the column heading for a description.

title: LTDS Appendix 6 - Fault Level Data
description:
Our LTDS Appendix 6 dataset contains data on faults, fault calculations and fault conditions on Northern Powergrid's HV and EHV circuits.

The data within Appendix 6 was derived from the latest Fault Level Survey and the values quoted are based on connected generation. This does not include any future connected generation (accepted schemes). Further details relating to the Fault Level Survey are available upon request. Any prospective customer requiring updated fault level information for a particular network node may request that information on a bespoke basis.

If you are unsure of any of the column meanings, please hover over the column heading for a description.

title: LTDS Appendix 7 - Generation
description:
Our LTDS Appendix 7 dataset contains data regarding generation on Northern Powergrid's network. The generation associated with each GSP, supply point and primary substation are included.

Our latest Embedded Capacity Register, which is updated monthly, provides up to date information on the total generation connected, or with an accepted quotation to connect, at each of our major substations, with a generation capacity of 1MW or greater. There is a new supplement to the Embedded Capacity Register that now includes generators from 50kW to 1MW.

If you are unsure of any of the column meanings, please hover over the column heading for a description.

Related Feature Pages

Long-Term Development Statement (LTDS) - Our LTDS provides essential network and asset information required to carry out studies of the NPg network to access potential connection points.

Embedded Capacity Register (ECR) - Our Embedded Capacity Register provides information on generation and storage sites, both connected to and accepted to connect to our network.

title: National Parks and National Landscapes
description:
This dataset contains geographic information about the National Parks and National Landscapes (formerly Areas of Outstanding Natural Beauty) in our region.


National Parks are run by National Park Authorities for the purpose of conserving and enhancing the natural beauty, wildlife and cultural heritage and to provide opportunities for the understanding and enjoyment of the Park by the public. 

AONBs are designated areas where protection is afforded to protect and manage the areas for visitors and local residents. Under the Countryside and Rights of Way Act 2000, Natural England has the power to designate areas of outstanding natural beauty (AONBs) in England that are outside national parks and that are considered to have such natural beauty it is desirable they are conserved and enhanced; issue a variation order to change an existing AONB boundary. It also holds a duty to give advice on developments taking place in an AONB; take into account the conservation and enhancement of AONBs in its work.


The original files can be found on the Natural England Open Data site here:

https://naturalengland-defra.opendata.arcgis.com/datasets/areas-of-outstanding-natural-beauty-england/explore

https://naturalengland-defra.opendata.arcgis.com/datasets/d333c7529754444894e2d7f5044d1bbf/explore
license: Northern Powergrid Open Data Licence v1.0

title: Curtailment Events Site Specific
description:
Our Curtailment Events Site Specific dataset shows specific instances where power generation in our Northeast and Yorkshire licence areas was reduced during the RIIO-ED2 period. The reductions were triggered by Northern Powergrid include operational or protection measures, managing planned outages, and related adjustments before and after outages.

Each row in the dataset represents a single event where power generation was reduced. It includes the start and end times, the estimated total amount of energy reduced, the average reduction in access, the reason for the reduction and the related Grid Supply Point (GSP). The total energy reduction is estimated based on recent operational history.

If you are unsure of any of the column meanings, please hover over the column heading for a description.

title: Smart Meter Penetration Volumes
description:
A monthly updated snapshot of the number of meters connected by local authority district and by meter category: smart; and not smart (analogue).

Specifically, our smart meter definition is that the meter is connected to the national communications infrastructure provided by the Data Communication Company (DCC).

Note 1: where Northern Powergrid borders other DNO boundaries and share coverage of common local authorities, only Northern Powergrid customers numbers are shown.

Note 2: the smart meters are mapped to Local Authority by post code using Office for National Statistics datasets which are updated periodically. However, Northern Powergrid smart meter installation counts are updated monthly.

Contains Local Authority district code and name data sourced from the Office for National Statistics licensed under the Open Government Licence v.3.0.
license: Northern Powergrid Open Data Licence v1.0

title: NPg Site Utilisation - Forecasted
description:
This dataset contains information on NPg's distribution substation sites, including their name, customer numbers, transformer size, max demand seen last year, utilisation, location and which local authority they fall within. Information on max demand and utilisation has been forecasted to 2050. The dataset can be used to check how much capacity is available on our substations, which allows users to understand network availability when investigating where to site new connections to the grid, such as new electric vehicle (EV) charge points.

A guide to EV installations with NPg can be found in the export tab of this dataset.

All sites that serve 5 or fewer customers have been redacted from this list.

Update Frequency : Annual

title: Northern Powergrid DFES BSP - Portal Format
description:
Our Distribution Future Energy Scenarios (DFES) BSP dataset contains information on various parameters such as energy usage, generation and Low Carbon Technologies (LCT) volumes, forecasting this data out to 2050. This data is produced for 5 different scenarios, assuming different rates of uptakes for various technologies. This dataset contains this information spilt per Bulk Supply Point within the Northern Powergrid region.

This dataset is new to our 2024 DFES publication, and has the data in a more portal friendly format. We recommend this dataset for users who are looking to build visuals with the mapping or charting functions within the portal.

We have used the information from this dataset to produce a DFES BSP Dashboard which can be found within the tabs of this dataset. This allows users to see each parameter graphed for substations, scenarios and/or year range they select.

Our 2024 DFES report and methodology can be found in the export tab under the "Alternative Exports" section at the bottom of the export list

Related datasets and pages

DFES Primary Substation - This dataset contains DFES information but this time aggregated to a Northern Powergrid Primary Substation level.

DFES Grid Supply Point (GSP) - This dataset contains DFES information but this time aggregated to a Northern Powergrid GSP level.

DFES Local Authority - This dataset contains DFES information but this time aggregated to a Local Authority region level.

DFES Whole Network - Users of our DFES in the past will be familiar with this format of DFES, containing information on all our EHV substations. We recommend this dataset for users simply looking to read a table of data.

DFES Feature Page - Users looking to find more information about the DFES, including our interactive geographical tool, or more information on navigating DFES data throughout our portal will find this page useful.

title: 3 Day Carbon Intensity by GSP
description:
Our 3 Day Carbon Intensity by GSP dataset provides information on the carbon impact of our Grid Supply Points based on the generation assets connected at each site. The dataset provides half hourly data in a 3 day window, with values for the power flow through the sites transformers totalled into one value, and a value for the carbon intensity of our site. We also provide the associated carbon intensity for the sites location from NESOs Carbon Intensity API.

If you are unsure of any of the column meanings, please hover over the column heading for a description.

title: Northern Powergrid DFES GSP - Portal Format
description:
Our Distribution Future Energy Scenarios (DFES) GSP dataset contains information on various parameters such as energy usage, generation and Low Carbon Technologies (LCT) volumes, forecasting this data out to 2050. This data is produced for 5 different scenarios, assuming different rates of uptakes for various technologies. This dataset contains this information spilt per Grid Supply Point within the Northern Powergrid region.

This dataset is new to our 2024 DFES publication, and has the data in a more portal friendly format. We recommend this dataset for users who are looking to build visuals with the mapping or charting functions within the portal.

We have used the information from this dataset to produce a DFES GSP Dashboard which can be found within the tabs of this dataset. This allows users to see each parameter graphed for substations, scenarios and/or year range they select.

Our 2024 DFES report and methodology can be found in the export tab under the "Alternative Exports" section at the bottom of the export list.

Related datasets and pages

DFES Primary Substation - This dataset contains DFES information but this time aggregated to a Northern Powergrid Primary Substation level.

DFES Bulk Supply Point - This dataset contains DFES information but this time aggregated to a Northern Powergrid BSP level.

DFES Local Authority - This dataset contains DFES information but this time aggregated to a Local Authority region level.

DFES Whole Network - Users of our DFES in the past will be familiar with this format of DFES, containing information on all our EHV substations. We recommend this dataset for users simply looking to read a table of data.

DFES Feature Page - Users looking to find more information about the DFES, including our interactive geographical tool, or more information on navigating DFES data throughout our portal will find this page useful.

Glossary of terms

Our Glossary dataset provides definitions for various terms and acronyms found throughout our data. If the term you are searching for isn't in our list, please let us know via our Open Data team and we will get it added!

Data Governance

If you wish to view the data triage document for any dataset, they can be found in our Data Triage Assessment dataset.

This dataset does NOT require a login to view

- None

title: Heat Map Data - Substation Areas
description:
Our Heat Map data provides the most updated substation by substation information related to our Extra High Voltage (EHV) and High Voltage (HV) network. Data such as firm capacity, max and min demands, existing and contracted generation/demand are used to calculate a thermal headroom figure for demand and generation. 

Fault level, tapchanger and National Grid Appendix G data are then used to calculate if there are any related constraints for each site other than thermal headroom.

If you are unsure of any of the column meanings, please hover over the column heading for a description.

Regional Demand and Generation Tracker - Our Regional Demand and Generation Tracker provides near real time data for the generation mix of our network over the last 30 days.

title: 30 Day Carbon Intensity by GSP
description:
Our 30 Day Carbon Intensity by GSP dataset provides information on the carbon impact of our Grid Supply Points based on the generation assets connected at each site. The dataset provides half hourly data in a 30 day window, with values for the power flow through the sites transformers totalled into one value, and a value for the carbon intensity of our site. We also provide the associated carbon intensity for the sites location from NESOs Carbon Intensity API.

If you are unsure of any of the column meanings, please hover over the column heading for a description.

title: Aggregated Smart Metering Data
description:
Our Aggregated Smart Metering Dataset provides half-hourly recordings of real and reactive power usage by smart meters in our licence areas where we are currently collecting this data. The data is collected monthly for a subset of our network assets

There are two types of datasets available to download, one with data aggregated to Low Voltage (LV) feeder level, and one aggregated to Distribution Substation level. All DNOs have agreed an interoperable methodology to sharing these consumption datasets, and a common format is used.

If you are unsure of any of the column meanings, please hover over the column heading for a description. A methodology for this dataset can be downloaded from the attachment section below.

- No error handling has been undertaken, eg to remove erroneous high values.

- Where less than five smart meter devices have responded within a half-hour period the aggregated consumption value has not been published, as a result there may be missing values and/or half-hour periods.

title: LCT Datasets Postal Districts
description:
Our LCT Datasets Postal Districts dataset gives the number of Low Carbon Technology (LCT) installations for each postal district on Northern Powergrid's network. The dataset also includes LCT penetration in that area, i.e. the number of LCT installations compared to the number of services in that area. In the custom view "LCT Heatmap" this has been represented in a heatmap format. When zoomed out Postal Districts are displayed, once zoomed further in, Postal Sectors can be viewed.

title: Artificial Forecasting Project Outputs
description:
Our Artificial Forecasting Project Outputs dataset contains findings from the beta-phase of the Artificial Forecasting SIF (strategic innovation fund) project. 

The data is from two sets of substations 

  1. Primary (EHV-HV transformation);
    • Gross demand (kW), customer export (kW) and net demand (kW).
    • Five years of historical data.
    • Contains 486 sites.
  2. Secondary (HV-LV transformation);
    • Net demand (W).
    • Three years of historical data.
    • Contains 800 sites.

At each substation type there are three sets of data

  1. Raw kilowatt data taken directly from measurement instruments at substations.
  2. Cleansed data, filtered and corrected for erroneous values.
  3. Example of forecast data for selected forecasting method.

Please Note: this data is the output of an innovation project and should not be considered as production quality. It is provided to allow interested parties to examine the project findings, not make technical or commercial decisions.

title: Project Progression Programme
description:
This data view is being updated in line with connections reform and the new six-monthly application windows. Customers are being individually updated on progress of transmission assessments for the initial window for existing agreements in 2025




The Project Progression Tracker provides status updates for live submissions of Modification Applications and Project Progressions for specific GSP’s to National Grid ESO.

The document will be updated on a monthly basis and will include dates when specific actions in the process have been completed as well as visibility of future applications not yet submitted for review by National Grid ESO.


You can find our transmission queue on a separate site here: https://gsppipeline.northernpowergrid.com/


Update Period: Monthly

title: Large Scale Demand
description:
Our Large Scale Demand dataset provides information on accepted demand connections on our network, aggregated up to EHV level, for each demand type. These are:

- Domestic

- Large Commercial

- Hospital

- Industrial

- Electric Vehicles 

In the near future we also plan to include installed connections in this dataset, to provide a full picture of the demand on the Northern Powergrid network.

NPg Site Utilisation - Our NPg Site Utilisation dataset provides information on utilisation on our secondary network. By taking the transformer rating and max demand seen the previous year, it gives insight into the remaining capacity of substations for LV connections.

title: LV Monitor Deployment Strategy
description:
Our LV Monitor Deployment Strategy dataset provides data about the low voltage (LV) monitors Northern Powergrid has committed to deploying in ED3. This dataset shows our shortlist of selected sites, of which 10,000 monitors will be deployed based upon on-site investigations. We have selected the sites based on customer numbers, transformer utilisation, feeder utilisation, low carbon technology penetration and IDNO connections.

The background on LV monitor deployment, reasoning behind the selection criteria and how the installations are prioritised is detailed in the methodology document which can be found in the export tab.

title: NPg Site Utilisation
description:
This dataset contains information on NPg's distribution substation sites, including their name, customer numbers, transformer size, max demand seen last year, utilisation, location and which local authority they fall within. The dataset can be used to check how much capacity is available on our substations, which allows users to understand network availability when investigating where to site new connections to the grid, such as new electric vehicle (EV) charge points.

A guide to EV installations with NPg can be found in the export tab of this dataset.


All sites that serve 5 or fewer customers have been redacted from this list.

title: NPg Network Development Plan
description:
Here you can view our Network Development Plan (NDP) Methodology, Network Development Report (NDR) and Network Headroom Report (NHR) as attachments below. The purpose of our NDR is to transparently communicate our investment decisions and future network intervention plans to stakeholders, and to highlight areas where Flexibility Services may be required.  Our NDP methodology provides a high-level description of the analysis and steps taken to produce our NDP. Our NHR provides information on possible future demand and generation capacity across a range of future scenarios.

Both our Methodology and our NDR can also be found as attachments on all 4 of our NDP datasets on the Portal.
license: Northern Powergrid Open Data Licence v1.0
tags: Network Development Plan (NDP), Network Development Report (NDR), Capacity, Headroom, Network Headroom Report (NHR), Interventions, Flexibility, Forecast, Methodology

description:
Our LTDS Extra High Voltage Sites dataset comprises of all the Northern Powergrid’s EHV operational sites, The geographical map of all EHV operational locations can be accessed via the “Network Map” tab on our LTDS page.

If you are unsure of any of the column meanings, please hover over the column heading for a description.

title: Embedded Capacity Register 1MW and Over
description:
Our Embedded Capacity Register (ECR) contains information on all generation, storage and flexible demand assets which are either already connected, or accepted to connect to the Northern Powergrid network. This information is updated by the 10th working day of each month and provides visibility to our stakeholders on distributed generation. Within this dataset, users can find the point of connection, voltage, capacity, connection status, generation type, flexibility information and dates for acceptances and connections.

This part of our ECR is for assets which have an installed capacity of 1MW or greater. The other half of our ECR can be found in the "similar datasets" section below.

If you are unsure of any of the column meanings, please hover over the column heading for a description. A methodology for this dataset can be downloaded from the attachment section below. 

Related Feature Pages

Embedded Capacity Register Page - Our Embedded Capacity Register provides information on generation and storage sites, both connected to and accepted to connect to our network.
NPg Generation Dashboard - Our Generation Dashboard presents information from our Embedded Capacity Register in a more visual format.
Regional Demand and Generation Tracker - Our Regional Demand and Generation Tracker provides near real time data for the generation mix of our network over the last 30 days.

Glossary of Terms

Our Glossary dataset provides definitions for various terms and acronyms found throughout our data. If the term you are searching for isn't in our list, please let us know via our Open Data team and we will get it added!

Data Governance

If you wish to view the data triage document for any dataset, they can be found in our Data Triage Assessment dataset.

This dataset does NOT require a login to view

title: Northern Powergrid DFES Primary - Portal Format
description:
Our Distribution Future Energy Scenarios (DFES) Primary dataset contains information on various parameters such as energy usage, generation and Low Carbon Technologies (LCT) volumes, forecasting this data out to 2050. This data is produced for 5 different scenarios, assuming different rates of uptakes for various technologies. This dataset contains this information spilt per primary substation within the Northern Powergrid region.

This dataset is new to our 2024 DFES publication, and has the data in a more portal friendly format. We recommend this dataset for users who are looking to build visuals with the mapping or charting functions within the portal.

We have used the information from this dataset to produce a DFES Primary Dashboard which can be found within the tabs of this dataset. This allows users to see each parameter graphed for substations, scenarios and/or year range they select.

Our 2024 DFES report and methodology can be found in the export tab under the "Alternative Exports" section at the bottom of the export list

Related datasets and pages

DFES Bulk Supply Point (BSP) - This dataset contains DFES information but this time aggregated to a Northern Powergrid BSP level.

DFES Grid Supply Point (GSP) - This dataset contains DFES information but this time aggregated to a Northern Powergrid GSP level.

DFES Local Authority - This dataset contains DFES information but this time aggregated to a Local Authority region level.

DFES Whole Network - Users of our DFES in the past will be familiar with this format of DFES, containing information on all our EHV substations. We recommend this dataset for users simply looking to read a table of data.

DFES Feature Page - Users looking to find more information about the DFES, including our interactive geographical tool, or more information on navigating DFES data throughout our portal will find this page useful.

Glossary of terms

Our Glossary dataset provides definitions for various terms and acronyms found throughout our data. If the term you are searching for isn't in our list, please let us know via our Open Data team and we will get it added!

Data Governance

If you wish to view the data triage document for any dataset, they can be found in our Data Triage Assessment dataset.

This dataset does NOT require a login to view

Any data caveats for the dataset are listed below

- None

title: LCT Datasets Postal Sectors
description:
Our LCT Datasets Postal Sectors dataset gives the number of Low Carbon Technology (LCT) installations for each postal sector on Northern Powergrid's network. The dataset also includes LCT penetration in that area, i.e. the number of LCT installations compared to the number of services in that area. In the custom view "LCT Heatmap" this has been represented in a heatmap format. When zoomed out Postal Districts are displayed, once zoomed further in, Postal Sectors can be viewed.

If you are unsure of any of the column meanings, please hover over the column heading for a description.

Related Feature Pages

Carbon Intensity Dashboard - Our Carbon Intensity Dashboard provides near real time data for the carbon intensity of our GSPs, with a heat map covering the last 3 days, and graphs for the last 30 days.

Smart Metering - Our Smart Metering page outlines what smart metering data we share on our Open Data Portal.

Local Authorities & Community Groups - Our Local Authority & Community Groups highlights which data on our Portal may be of use to this user group, as well as giving examples of how our data is being used.

title: Glossary of Terms
description:
Our Glossary of Terms dataset contains a list of terms used throughout our Portal and supporting documentation, with a definition and associated acronyms if applicable.

For ease of use, we recommend using the custom "Index" tab for this dataset rather than the standard table, as this will allow you to view the full definition. The search on the left will still function in this tab. If you have a term you were expecting to find in our Glossary that is not present, please contact our Open Data Team and we will get it added. Our Glossary can be accessed via any of our dataset descriptions in the section below the introduction.

title: NPg Network Development Plan - Thermal Demand Headroom
description:
This dataset contains the demand forecasting for both our Northeast and Yorkshire licence areas. Our Network Development Plan (NDP) includes our plans for interventions, flexibility services requirements and forecast demand and generation headroom across our network, for a range of different scenarios, in the medium to long-term. To view our forecasted generation headroom please click here. To view our NDP Methodology and Report, please see the attachments below.


Update Frequency: Headroom report - Annually (May), Methodology – Every two years (Due May 2024)

tags: Demand, Forecast, Headroom, Capacity, Network Development Plan (NDP), Extra High Voltage (EHV), Methodology

title: EHV Substation Combined Service Areas
description:
Our EHV Substation combined service areas dataset provides an interactive shapefile to indicate the service areas of our Grid Supply Points, Bulk Supply Points, and Primary substations. Users can filter for each of these substation levels using the left hand panel.

These shapefiles show where the bulk of connections to each substation can be found. There could be cases where large, individual connections will fall into the shapefile of one substation, but is in fact supplied by a neighbouring site.

title: 30 Day Generation Mix Northeast
description:
Our 30 Day Generation Mix Northeast dataset provides information on the breakdown of generation technologies within our Northeast licence area. The dataset provides half hourly data in a 30 day window, with values for each generation type along with a demand and generation total, as well as the Carbon Intensity for the whole licence area. We also provide the associated carbon intensity for the sites location from NESOs Carbon Intensity API.

If you are unsure of any of the column meanings, please hover over the column heading for a description.

title: Interruptions Incentive Scheme
description:
Introduction

The dataset provides detailed information about UK Power Networks' unplanned fault reporting under the Ofgem Interruptions Incentive Scheme (IIS).

It includes key characteristics such as:

  • Date/time fault start/end
  • Number of customers affected
  • Restoration stages
  • Cause and main equipment involved
  • Status of fault in terms of its exclusion from the IIS scheme due to it being a one-off /severe weather fault
  • The upstream primary substation to the fault

More information about the IIS can be found on Ofgem's website or this document: RIIO-ED2 Regulatory Instructions and Guidance – Interruptions

Methodological Approach

  • Source: IIS returns post application of Ofgem decision one status of fault in terms of its exclusion from the IIS scheme due to it being a one-off /severe weather fault
  • Manipulation: Includes all rows from unplanned fault reporting IIS returns with calculation of CI/CML removed, leaving source data only i.e. no calculated fields
  • Addition: Inclusion of the sitefunctional location of the upstream Primary substation and its geopoint.

Quality Control Statement

The data is provided "as is".

Assurance Statement

The Regulation Team checked to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

Other

Download dataset information: Metadata (JSON)

Definitions of key terms related to this dataset can be found in the Open Data Portal Glossary: https://ukpowernetworks.opendatasoft.com/pages/glossary/

To view this data please register and login.

title: UK Power Networks Grid Substation Distribution Areas
description:
Introduction

This dataset is a geospatial view of the areas fed by grid substations. The aim is to create an indicative map showing the extent to which individual grid substations feed areas based on MPAN data.

Methodology

  • Data Extraction and Cleaning: MPAN data is queried from SQL Server and saved as a CSV. Invalid values and incorrectly formatted postcodes are removed using a Test Filter in FME.
  • Data Filtering and Assignment: MPAN data is categorized into EPN, LPN, and SPN based on the first two digits. Postcodes are assigned a Primary based on the highest number of MPANs fed from different Primary Sites.
  • Polygon Creation and Cleaning: Primary Feed Polygons are created and cleaned to remove holes and inclusions. Donut Polygons (holes) are identified, assigned to the nearest Primary, and merged.
  • Grid Supply Point Integration: Primaries are merged into larger polygons based on Grid Site relationships. ny Primaries not fed from a Grid Site are marked as NULL and labeled.
  • Functional Location Codes (FLOC) Matching: FLOC codes are extracted and matched to Primaries, Grid Sites and Grid Supply Points. Confirmed FLOCs are used to ensure accuracy, with any unmatched sites reviewed by the Open Data Team.

Quality Control Statement

Quality Control Measures include:

  • Verification steps to match features only with confirmed functional locations.
  • Manual review and correct of data inconsistencies
  • Use of additional verification steps to ensure accuracy in the methodology
  • Regular updates and reviews documented in the version history

Assurance Statement

The Open Data Team and Network Data Team worked with the Geospatial Data Engineering Team to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

Other

Download dataset information: Metadata (JSON)

Definitions of key terms related to this dataset can be found in the Open Data Portal Glossary: https://ukpowernetworks.opendatasoft.com/pages/glossary/

To view this data please register and login.

title: UK Power Networks Secondary Substation Distribution Areas
description:
Introduction

A shapefile containing the postcode areas supplied by secondary substations.

Methodological approach

The dataset is generalised using our GIS customer connectivity model. Each Secondary Substation's connected LV Network is traced out to its electrical extents, including all connected customers. Using the geographic position of customer connections and key network points of both the Substation being traced and surrounding Substation's network, a Voronoi diagram is created. Each Voronoi polygon that intersects with the traced network is joined together to produce a single polygon, depicting the Supply Zone.

Quality Control Statement

The data is provided "as is".

Assurance Statement

The Open Data team has checked the data against source to ensure data accuracy and consistency. The data domain owners have checked their respective data aspects.

This dataset is redacted in that any secondary sites with less than five customers will not be included to protect privacy.

Other

Download dataset information: Metadata (JSON)

Definitions of key terms related to this dataset can be found in the Open Data Portal Glossary: https://ukpowernetworks.opendatasoft.com/pages/glossary/

To view this data please register and login.

title: UK Power Networks Secondary Site Utilisation
description:
Introduction

This dataset shows the utilisation band of our secondary sites across our three networks, over 1 April 2022 to 31 March 2023.

This dataset is a redacted version of an annual regulatory submission to Ofgem. The data consists of a single utilisation value over a year for each of UK Power Networks secondary substation. This dataset is redacted in that any secondary sites with five or less customers will not be included to protect privacy.

This dataset is a mixture of actual utilisation data and analytics based on transformer profile. The utilisation bands do not indicate contractually committed capacity e.g. capacity on our network may be unused now but expected to be used by a connection in a future year, recent acceptances which will be covered in next year's data.

If you notice any errors, please let us know by feedbacking against the record in the table tab.

Methodological Approach

UK Power Networks worked with other DNOs and the Energy Networks Association (ENA), to agree a methodology to calculating transformer utilisation.

It considered the following:

  • Transformer rating;
  • Current peak loading;
  • Year demand growth;
  • Year ahead peak demand; and
  • Utilisation calculation.

    • Quality Control Statement

    This dataset is provided "as is".

    Assurance Statement

    The Open Data Team and DSO Network Strategy Team worked to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

    Other

    Download dataset information: Metadata (JSON)

    Definitions of key terms related to this dataset can be found in the Open Data Portal Glossary: https://ukpowernetworks.opendatasoft.com/pages/glossary/

title: Onshore Wind Power Land Suitability (IRENES)
description:
Introduction

This dataset provides the locations of areas that restrict the suitability of land for onshore wind developments; such as roads, residential areas, world heritage sites, agricultural land, and flood zones. In addition, it calculates the potential energy density of over 3.5 million individual areas for both solar and wind installations using windspeed and solar irradiance data.

This results in an overall assessment of the suitability of a specific area for installing solar and wind generation. The assessment grades land as either YES – suitable, No – not suitable, or MAYBE – could be suitable.

Methodological Approach

This dataset was developed for UK Power Networks licence area by UEA Consulting Limited. It is based on public domain sources and previous analysis that was carried out as part of the IRENES EU Interreg project which examined renewable energy sources in eastern England.

To view the methodology behind this data please click here.

This dataset displays the wind data, click here for the solar PV data

Quality Control Statement

This dataset is provided "as is".

Assurance Statement

The Open Data Team and Local Net Zero Team worked together to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

Other

Download dataset information: Metadata (JSON)

Definitions of key terms related to this dataset can be found in the Open Data Portal Glossary: https://ukpowernetworks.opendatasoft.com/pages/glossary/

To view this data please register and login.

title: Network Losses
description:
Introduction

This dataset contains the total losses across the network. 

Distributing electricity across a large area inevitably leads to electrical 'losses'. In simple terms, the energy entering our network is higher than the energy received by our customers and this is what we call a 'loss'. Losses can occur in a number of ways, please refer to our losses site for more information.

Methodological Approach

Network losses in this dataset are calculated as the difference between units of electricity entering the network and units exiting the network. Due to delays in the data required to calculate the losses, final losses are not determined until 14 months after the date, referred to in this dataset as 'RF', albeit these can still change for up to 6 years due to corrections to IDNO and half-hourly customers' data.

Delayed data includes the consumption of domestic customers and generation of small generators due to infrequent meter readings. Initial estimates are made (for example, estimated domestic bills), and it takes 5 reconciliations over a 14 month period to approach an accurate figure for units exiting the network. Our reporting is often required at the start of this reconciliation cycle, so the most up to date data available at that time is used but this will become outdated as further reconciliations come in.

In addition to the reconciliations, the values used for our reporting are displayed in columns labelled 'Regulatory Reporting'. In some areas the reported values are not an exact match for any previous iteration of the data. This is due to metering errors of half hourly metered customers which are later corrected by the customer.

Consumption data is sourced from Elexon, the company that manage the Balancing and Settlement Code. The main purpose of this data is to provide the data for billing DUoS, hence it is not necessarily complete for unbilled consumption or generation.

Quality Control Statement

Data is provided "as is".

Data has been checked against regulatory submissions for consistency

Assurance Statement

The Open Data Team and Net Zero & Network Development Team worked together to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

Other

Download dataset information: Metadata (JSON)

Definitions of key terms related to this dataset can be found in the Open Data Portal Glossary: https://ukpowernetworks.opendatasoft.com/pages/glossary/

To view this data please register and login.

title: Project Optimise Prime - Commercial Electric Vehicles Trial
description:
Introduction

Optimise Prime has gathered data from over 8,000 electric vehicles (EVs) driven for commercial purposes through three trials. The project also implemented a range of technical and commercial solutions aiming to accelerate the transition to EVs for commercial fleet operators, while helping GB’s distribution networks plan and prepare for the mass adoption of EVs. The project aimed to reduce the impact of EVs on distribution networks and ensure security of electricity supply while saving money for electricity customers, helping the UK meet its clean air and climate change objectives.

Methodology

This is provided in the project links below.

Quality Control Statement

This dataset is provided "as is".

Assurance Statement

The Open Data Team and Innovation Lead checked for data accuracy and consistency.

Other

Download dataset information: Metadata (JSON)

Definitions of key terms related to this dataset can be found in the Open Data Portal Glossary:https://ukpowernetworks.opendatasoft.com/pages/glossary/

Methodological Approach

The project consisted of three trial workstreams (WS):

  • WS1, investigating the impact of commercial vehicles charging at homes
  • WS2, monitoring and optimising commercial vehicles charging in depots
  • WS3, which uses private hire vehicle (PHV) journey data to model the impact of these vehicles on the distribution network.

The trial period for WS3 began in August 2020, with WS1 and WS2 trials commencing on 1 July 2021. All trials concluded at the end of June 2022.

Optimise Prime is sharing the project datasets by making them publicly available to the wider electricity, fleet and PHV industry to optimise their vehicle electrification plans. Distribution Network Operators (DNOs), academics and interested parties will be able to utilise this anonymised data created by the project for further research, analysis and forecasting. Along with the datasets, an introductory document is available below. It provides information on the content of those datasets, guidance on how to interpret each data field and instructions on how to access the data.

Over the course of the trials, the project has collected and analysed data from a wide range of sources in order to carry out a wide range of experiments. The key datasets collected and used in analysis are available here. These includes:

WS1 – Return-to-Home Trials

·      Charge Point (CP) session data

·      Vehicle telematics journey data

WS2 – Depot Trials

·      Details of the assets and asset types at each depot

·      Charging data gathered from the CPs at each depot

·      Building load measurement data from each depot

·      Details of the profiled connections, flexibility trials and smart charging profiles trialled at each depot

WS3 – Mixed Trials

·      PHV charging demand overlaid onto substation available capacity data aggregated by borough


The project is not able to release all data collected and used by the project, as some are commercially confidential to the project partners (such as precise volumes of Uber trips or substation capacities), contains potentially personally identifiable information (such as precise start and end locations of home charging journeys or Uber trips) or were purchased by the project under license (e.g. charge point (CP) locations, weather data and off-street parking data).

The figure below shows how the datasets are built:


To access the datasets, use the below Account name and Shared Access Signature (SAS) token (used due to the large size of these data sets - if you are not familiar with this method, please refer to the guide at the bottom of this page):

Refer to Section 5 in the Optimise Prime Dataset Guidance Document, in the Attachments section below, for more information on how to access the datasets.

Any questions, please refer to the FAQ document in the attachments section first, if your questions is not answered, please contact innovation@ukpowernetworks.co.uk.

For further information about Optimise Prime and access the project reports, please visit: UK Power Networks Innovation - Optimise Prime

title: Project Enable - Projections for Blue Badge Holders and Parking Bays
description:
Introduction

As part of our Enable project, we estimated the projected number of on-street disabled parking bays and Blue Badge holders in our licence areas by 2030. This data is available at the Lower Layer Super Output Area (LSOA) level. We hope that this data will help local authorities and charge point operators plan for accessible transport provision for customers.

This project started in March 2021 and concluded in March 2022.

More information on what we're doing for accessible transport can be found at UK Power Networks Accessible transport information hub and project-enable.

Please note, the dataset contains estimations and are not true values.

Methodological Approach

Details on the methodology can be found in the project report - Project Enable.

Quality Control Statement

Quality Control Measures include:

  • Manual review and correct of data inconsistencies
  • Use of additional verification steps to ensure accuracy in the methodology

    • Assurance Statement

    The Open Data Team and Innovation Team worked together to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

title: Strategic Housing Land Availability Assessment (SHLAA)
description:
Introduction

A Strategic Housing Land Availability Assessment (SHLAA) is a technical exercise to determine the quantity and suitability of land potentially available for housing development. It is not a site allocations exercise – the purpose is to provide a robust indication of aggregate housing capacity at local authority level.

Please note this dataset is restricted, and if you would like to be considered for access, please contact: "opendata@ukpowernetworks.co.uk"

This dataset is a collation of SHLAAs that UK Power Networks has access to, and is primarily for use in conjunction with the Noise Propagation dataset.

Methodological Approach

This dataset was compiled using different SHLAA files that UK Power Networks owned and received from local authorities.

Quality Control Statement

  • Manual review and correct of data inconsistencies

title: Areas Affected by Noise from Grid or Primary Sites
description:
Introduction 

These maps show the potential area affected by noise from Grid or Primary Substations. Acoustic mitigation strategies that have already been applied to some substations are not reflected in the maps.Please take this into account when looking at individual sites.

Please note this dataset is restricted, and if you would like to be considered for access, please contact: "opendata @ukpowernetworks.co.uk"

Developers and local authority planners should be aware that the responsibility to mitigate noise issues rests with the developer as the ‘agent of change’.

Methodological Approach

There are three contours:

Distance (m)

Predicted Noise Level (dBA)

Complaints

Action

4044Likely from any new residential developmentPlease consult environment@ukpowernetworks.co.uk
7539Possible from any new residential developmentPlease consult environment@ukpowernetworks.co.uk
13534Not very likely

Quality Control Statement

title: Long Term Development Statement (LTDS) Table 7 Operational Restrictions
description:
Introduction

The Long Term Development Statements (LTDS) report on a 0-5 year period, describing a forecast of load on the network and envisioned network developments. The LTDS is published at the end of May and November each year.

Long Term Development Statement Table 7 indicates Operational Restrictions in place at our Grid and Primary substations. Published 30 May 2025.

More information and full reports are available from the landing page below:
Long Term Development Statement and Network Development Plan Landing Page

Methodological Approach

  • Site Functional Locations (FLOCs) are used to associate the Substation to Key characteristics of active Grid and Primary sites — UK Power Networks 
  • ID field added to identify row number for reference purposes

Quality Control Statement

Quality Control Measures include:

  • Verification steps to match features only with confirmed functional locations.
  • Manual review and correction of data inconsistencies.
  • Use of additional verification steps to ensure accuracy in the methodology.

Assurance Statement

The Open Data Team and Network Insights Team together ensure data accuracy and consistency.

title: Long Term Development Statement (LTDS) Table 2b Transformer Data - 3W
description:
Introduction

title: Embedded Capacity Register 1 - under 1MW
description:
Introduction

The Embedded Capacity Register (ECR) lists all generation, storage, and flexible demand resources where the installed generation capacity, export capacity, or import capacity is 50kW to 1MW.

More information can be found here: Embedded Capacity Register

Methodological Approach

  • Data Collection: The data is sourced from various internal systems, including the data warehouse and other operational databases. This ensures comprehensive coverage of all relevant resources; and
  • Data Integration: The collected data is integrated and organized to provide a clear view of the capacity and distribution of these resources across different license areas. This includes details such as location coordinates, energy source, conversion technology, and associated substations.

Quality Control Statement

The data is provided "as is".

Assurance Statement

We are aware that not all cells are fully populated on the ECR. We are working hard to gather and check data so that we can provide the missing information as soon as possible. If you notice any errors or omissions, please email us at DG-Q&A@ukpowernetworks.co.uk.

title: Flexibility Tender Data by Postcode
description:
Introduction

This dataset provides information on where UK Power Networks requires flexibility services. The dataset provides a mapping of postcodes to Flexibility Zones – for all existing and historic day-ahead and long-term flexibility requirements.

This enables potential flexibility service providers to quickly understand their eligibility for revenue from flexibility, without sharing any sensitive personal or commercial information.

This dataset provides an approximation of eligibility for our flexibility tenders. Please note that even if your asset is within a postcode listed in this dataset, as part of the flexibility procurement process we will need to validate that the individual meter point (MPAN) is electrically connected to the Flexibility Zone.

Methodological Approach

Postcodes are listed against a Flexibility Zone where at least one meter point within that postcode is electrically connected to the constrained network asset.

For large Flexibility Zones, which cover multiple postcodes, this will be a very good indication of eligibility for flexibility services. For smaller Flexibility Zones, particularly those at Low Voltage, a significant proportion of properties within a listed postcode may ultimately not be eligible.

As part of our flexibility procurement process, we will check the individual meter point (MPAN) to confirm its final eligibility. This dataset offers an approximation of eligibility, without requiring any sharing of household or business level data.

Quality Control Statement

Dispatches are passed through a quality control algorithm to flag anomalies and erroneous data. Quality control checks include:

  • Checking the formatting of postcodes

  • Checking the number of postcodes mapped to each Flexibility Zone

  • Checking that Flexibility Zone names align with those in other datasets on the Open Data Portal and on UK Power Networks’ chosen flexibility market platform: www.localflex.co.uk

    • Assurance Statement

    The Flex Zone to Postcode mapping is reviewed before publication by a member of Flexibility Markets team.

    Other

    Download dataset information: Metadata (JSON)

    Definitions of key terms related to this dataset can be found in the Open Data Portal Glossary: https://ukpowernetworks.opendatasoft.com/pages/glossary/

    To view this data please register and login.

title: Flexibility Dispatches
description:
Introduction

This dataset reports on UK Power Networks' use of paid flexibility services. UK Power Networks uses flexibility (demand/generation turn up/down) in London, the South East, and the East of England to manage electricity flows on the local electricity distribution network.

Flexibility dispatches data can be used to understand historical volumes, prices paid, geographic locations, providers, and technologies used. Using the Analyse tab, users can visualize and explore the growth of flexibility dispatches. These transparent insights can inform current and prospective flexibility services providers on how often flexibility is dispatched and at what price, including local authorities, electricity suppliers, industrial/commercial energy users, and generation operators. The data can also be used by wider stakeholders such as market analysts, advisers, regulators, and policymakers.

A wide variety of energy resources and low carbon technologies already provide flexibility services to UK Power Networks, including grid-scale batteries, electric vehicle charge points, solar farms, wind farms, and residential energy users. These are grouped using the industry standard technology categorizations as used for regulatory reporting. To find out more about how to participate in flexibility tenders and become a flexibility provider, visit our webpage: Flexibility - UKPN DSO (ukpowernetworks.co.uk).

Flexibility dispatches are currently reported from 1 April 2023, with new dispatches added monthly. Each row includes the timing, location, product, capacity, technology, and provider for our growing volume of flexibility dispatches. The data is assessed for errors using algorithmic quality control as well as being evaluated manually by a flexibility engineer before publication. The dataset can be downloaded or incorporated into the user’s interface via API.

Requested volumes may not match delivered volumes, depending on performance against the relevant baseline. You can find actual dispatch data in the yearly Procurement Statements and Reports at Tender Hub - UKPN DSO (ukpowernetworks.co.uk). This includes our annual Flexibility Statement (forecasts for the next regulatory year), Flexibility Report (outcomes from last regulatory year), and data appendices.

Methodological Approach

  • Dispatches are made by a control engineer in the DSO Operations team to manage local constraints. Dispatches of flexible units (FUs) may be made either by API or email, depending on the FU's technological capabilities and preference.
  • This dataset reports on dispatches made under Secure, Dynamic, and Day-Ahead products. Flexibility provided through our Sustain product is not dispatched and hence is not included within this dataset.
  • Requested volumes may not match delivered volumes, depending on performance against the relevant baseline.

    Historic data may be updated from time to time where data errors are identified.

Quality Control Statement

Dispatches are passed through a quality control algorithm to flag anomalies and erroneous data. Quality control checks include:

  • Times are consistent with the contracted service window;
  • Dispatches are matched to the correct flexibility zone;
  • Dispatches are unique (no duplicates);
  • Dispatches are issued at the contracted price and volume;
  • Dispatches are matched with an active contract.

Assurance Statement

The flexibility dispatch report is reviewed by a flexibility engineer and a member of the Data Science team to ensure the data is accurate before publication on the Open Data Portal. Any data errors in previous reports are corrected on an ongoing basis and updated monthly.

Other
